intro: Brachyscome dichromosomatica var. alba, commonly known as the white star bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy white flowers that resemble stars. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces a compact, bushy growth habit. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often used in gardens and coastal landscapes.
